keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Our reporter and photographer visited a Navy cruiser in the South China Sea, where rising tensions are expected to be a focus of talks between President Obama and China’s president this week.

headline.print_headline: Shadowboxing With China in Disputed Waters
headline.main: Patrolling Disputed Waters, U.S. and China Jockey for Dominance

snippet: Our reporter and photographer visited a Navy cruiser in the South China Sea, where rising tensions are expected to be a focus of talks between President Obama and China’s president this week.
abstract: Obama administration is sending Navy patrols through South China Sea as check against Chinese efforts to stake firmer claim on uninhabited and disputed islands in area, where they engage with Chinese ships in kind of delicate dance on high seas; Chinese ambitions in South China Sea will likely be main issue in upcoming talks between Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping.
